comments:
Replace “mitochondrial dysfunction” with “mitochondrial intensity/morphology change” unless you add functional readouts (OCR, ATP, ROS, membrane potential with orthogonal dyes).

Show per-well distributions, replicate consistency across plates/sites, and confirm the effect is not driven by cell count, confluence, segmentation quality, or cell-cycle residuals.

Use multiple mitochondrial features (texture, area, object count, tubeness, radial distribution), not just intensity, and report whether they co-move.

Address multiple testing (FDR or permutation) since you screen many genes and features.

Strengthen the disease link: test NOTCH3 perturbations with mitochondrial readouts (and ideally CADASIL-like NOTCH3 variants or VSMC models).

Fill the missing sections (comparators, similarity analysis, HPA/literature citations) and separate “data result” from “hypothesis/speculation.”
